title: 109_hr6073
content: The "Dr. James Allen Veteran Vision Equity Act" enhances compensation benefits for veterans with impaired vision in both eyes, with a visual acuity of 20/200 or less. Additionally, the act allows the use of the National Directory of New Hires for income verification purposes for certain veterans benefits. The amendment allows the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to use the National Directory of New Hires for income verification of individuals under 65 applying for specified benefits. The Secretary will seek essential information to determine eligibility for benefits and services for individuals under 65. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will compare data with the National Directory of New Hires for specified purposes. The Secretary may use data match information for determining eligibility and benefit amounts, reimbursing additional costs to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Beneficiaries will be notified accordingly. The Secretary notifies applicants and recipients of specified benefits that their income information may be compared with data from the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Independent verification is required before terminating or reducing benefits. Covered benefits and services include employment-related information. The specified benefits include needs-based pension benefits, parents' dependency and indemnity compensation, health-care services, and compensation for unemployability under chapter 11. The Secretary may independently verify wage information in unemployability cases. The Secretary may verify wage information in unemployability cases to determine eligibility for benefits. The individual will be informed of the findings and given an opportunity to contest them. Expenses for administering this section will be covered by the Department's funds. The Secretary can verify wage information for unemployability cases to assess benefit eligibility. The authority to obtain information from the Secretary of Health and Human Services expires on September 30, 2010. Section 5320 of title 38, United States Code allows the use of the National Directory of New Hires for income verification purposes. This section will take effect 270 days after the enactment of the Act.
